name: Woosh Portfolio
author: elrond1369

sections.description: Simply display your design projects and descriptive text. This plugin can display 4 images from the Media Library, a YouTube video or a Vimeo video. You can view a demo of the plugin on my Portfolio Site
sections.installation:
1. Place in wp-content/plugin
  2. Type in a name for a portfolio then click “New Portfolio”
  3. Select media type then click “New section”
  • Media Library
  1. Click on add image to select an image
  2. Enter data for header, view content url, and text sections
  3. Click Save
  • YouTube
  1. Go to your YouTube Video
  2. Copy the part of the url after “v=”
  3. Paste it into the “View Content” field
  4. Add header and text then click Save.
  • Vimeo
  1. Go to your Vimeo video
  2. Click share…it looks like a paper airplain
  3. Copy the link and paste into View Content URL

  4. Remove all the url except the number at the end

  5. Add shortcode [woosh name=”name”] to a blank page or post.
sections.changelog:
1.0.0

  • Initial release

1.0.1

  • Improved loading: Loads images after page has finished loading.

1.0.2

  • Fixed output so content can be placed before portfolio.

1.1.0

  • Added ability to create multiple portfolios.
  • Fixed issue with overlay showing a short time after page load.
  • Changed saving to require button click
  • All section data get saved all at once now.
  • You will need to change current portfolio shortcode from [woosh] to [woosh name=”-“]

1.2.0

  • Added YouTube embedding.

1.2.1

  • Changed YouTube videos to load header and description from YouTube.

1.2.2

  • CSS improvements

1.3.0

  • Added Vimeo support
  • Confirmed compatible with WordPress 4.0.0 “Benny”

1.3.1

  • Made YouTube and Vimeo videos responsive
  • Removed a console.log that was left from the last update
